SPECIAL PROCEDURES AND OPERATIONS : A heterotopic kidney transplant , placed in the left pelvic fossa and native left nephrectomy on 8-29-94 . OTHER PROCEDURES : 1. colonoscopy on 9-5-94 , 4. renal biopsy on 9-13-94 . He started on dialysis in 03/92 and has been maintained on it since . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : The patient is status post left arteriovenous fistula creation . 1. hypertension , 2. difficulty hearing , 4. history of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation , two prior episodes . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : ALLERGIES : The patient has no known drug allergies . REVIEW OF SYSTEMS : The review of systems was negative . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : The physical examination was unremarkable . HOSPITAL COURSE : During this time , he never developed a fever , leukocytosis , or peritoneal signs . The patient was therefore brought to the Operating Room where he was found to have a perforated sigmoid colon with gross soilage of the peritoneal cavity . He was further found to have what appeared to be an area of diverticulitis with abscess formation in his sigmoid colon . The subsequent pathology report confirmed the initial impression that this was indeed diverticulitis in the setting of diverticulosis and acute and chronic inflammation with abscess formation in the sigmoid colon . The patient continued to improve postoperatively and had essentially an unremarkable course with the exception that his creatinine became elevated . A renal biopsy was then performed which failed to show signs of rejection . It was therefore felt that his elevation in creatinine was multifactorial related to the events surrounding surgery and the surgery itself . With just observation alone , his creatinine returned to a level of 2.0 by the time of discharge . The patient was discharged home in stable condition and will follow up with the clinic . Postoperatively , the patient did develop atrial fibrillation which was felt to be related to electrolyte disturbances as well as perioperative stress . He ruled out for myocardial infarction . Again , he does have a history of paroxysmal atrial tachycardia for which he came in the hospital with verapamil treatment . He did have some postoperative hypertension which was controlled with Cardura and sublingual nifedipine prn .
